title: Getting started with a4syahpradana
text: a4syahpradana package provides tools explore common American names. contains cleaned dataset (common_names), helper function ranking summarising names, Shiny dashboard interactive visualisation. vignette walks typical workflow, exploring dataset, ranking visualising names, finally launching dashboard.

title: Getting started with a4syahpradana
text: dataset common_names includes first last names along baseline (estimate) adjusted (final_estimate) population counts. total rows columns follow:
code: data("common_names") head(common_names) #> # A tibble: 6 × 6 #>   first_name surname clean_name      adjustment estimate final_estimate #>   <chr>      <chr>   <chr>                <dbl>    <dbl>          <dbl> #> 1 James      Smith   james smith           21.1   25838.         31290. #> 2 Michael    Smith   michael smith          5.6   29276.         30915. #> 3 Robert     Smith   robert smith           8.7   24005.         26094. #> 4 David      Smith   david smith           10.8   22614.         25056. #> 5 James      Johnson james johnson          9.6   20498.         22466. #> 6 Michael    Johnson michael johnson       -4.8   23226.         22111. tibble(rows = nrow(common_names),        cols = ncol(common_names)) #> # A tibble: 1 × 2 #>    rows  cols #>   <int> <int> #> 1   400     6

title: Getting started with a4syahpradana
text: following table describes variables included dataset. Variables common_names
code: tibble::tibble(   variable = c("first_name","surname","clean_name",                "adjustment","estimate","final_estimate"),   type = c("character","character","character",            "numeric","numeric","numeric"),   description = c("Given name","Family name",                   "Standardised full name key",                   "Adjustment applied to baseline",                   "Baseline count (people)",                   "Adjusted count (people)")) |>   knitr::kable(caption = "Variables in `common_names`")

title: Getting started with a4syahpradana
text: function top_ranked_names() summarises data returns top names based either baseline adjusted counts. example displaying top 10 first names ranked final estimate.
code: top10 <- top_ranked_names(type = "first",                           measure = "final_estimate",                           n = 10) top10 #> # A tibble: 10 × 2 #>    name      Count #>    <chr>     <dbl> #>  1 James   246825. #>  2 Michael 242106. #>  3 Robert  218994. #>  4 David   201478. #>  5 John    173733. #>  6 William 164474. #>  7 Mary    162912. #>  8 Richard 115193. #>  9 Charles 112048. #> 10 Daniel  111114.

title: Getting started with a4syahpradana
text: order make results easier interpret, can create simple plot.
code: top10 <- top_ranked_names(type = "first",                           measure = "final_estimate",                           n = 10) |>   dplyr::rename(name = 1, count = 2)  ggplot(top10, aes(x = reorder(name, count), y = count)) +   geom_col(fill = "#2C7FB8") +   coord_flip() +   ggplot2::scale_y_continuous(labels = scales::comma) +   labs(x = NULL, y = "Number of people",        title = "Top 10 First Names by Final Estimate") +   theme_minimal(base_size = 13)

title: Getting started with a4syahpradana
text: interactive exploration, launch built-Shiny app. allows users filter first, last, full names, compare baseline adjusted counts, visualise rankings dynamically.

title: a4syahpradana
text: a4syahpradana R package provides cleaned dataset interactive tools explore common American names. includes: common_names: dataset first names, surnames, adjusted population estimates top_ranked_names(): helper function ranking summarising names run_names_app(): Shiny dashboard interactive visualisation

title: a4syahpradana
text: can install development version GitHub:

title: a4syahpradana
code: # Load package library(a4syahpradana) # Explore dataset data("common_names") head(common_names)  # View top-ranked names top_ranked_names(n = 10)

title: a4syahpradana
text: visualise results interactively, launch dashboard:

what: a4syahpradana: Exploring Common American Names — a4syahpradana
title: a4syahpradana: Exploring Common American Names — a4syahpradana
text: package contains:

title: a4syahpradana: Exploring Common American Names — a4syahpradana
text: common_names — cleaned dataset common American name combinations. top_ranked_names() — helper summarise rank names. run_names_app() — launches interactive Shiny app.

title: a4syahpradana: Exploring Common American Names — a4syahpradana
text: Maintainer: Akbar Rakha Syahpradana asya0008@student.monash.edu

title: Common American Names — common_names
text: dataset containing common American first last name combinations, baseline (Estimate) adjusted (Final estimate) counts.

title: Common American Names — common_names
text: data frame 6 variables: first_name Given name surname Family name clean_name Standardised lowercase full name adjustment Numeric adjustment applied estimate Baseline count value final_estimate Adjusted count value

title: Common American Names — common_names
text: Derived public U.S. name frequency data

what: Launch the Common Names dashboard — run_names_app
title: Launch the Common Names dashboard — run_names_app
text: Launch Common Names dashboard

title: Launch the Common Names dashboard — run_names_app
Get top-ranked names — top_ranked_names
text: Summarises ranks names count using either baseline adjusted values.

title: Get top-ranked names — top_ranked_names
code: top_ranked_names(   data = a4syahpradana::common_names,   type = c("first", "last"),   measure = c("estimate", "final_estimate"),   starts_with = NULL,   n = 10 )

title: Get top-ranked names — top_ranked_names
text: data Data frame, default a4syahpradana::common_names type "first" first names "last" surnames measure Either "estimate" "final_estimate" starts_with Optional prefix filter names (case-insensitive) n Number top names return

title: Get top-ranked names — top_ranked_names
text: tibble columns Name Count.
